ygData.subject: Re: [The EverQuest Tavern] Greetings
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually Stauchnad, Lake Rathe is actually a part of Antonica.  From the sounds of it  the gnolls you are talking about are near the South Karana zone.  I
ygData.messageBody:
Actually Stauchnad,

Lake Rathe is actually a part of Antonica. From the sounds of it the
gnolls you are talking about are near the South Karana zone. I don't
remember when Bards get the Equivalent of sow nor do I remember when they
get Invis song. But if you can find someone who can float you so you don't
have to wear yourself out on swimming form the Arena, Invis and sow you or
even accompany you then that would be the best route for you to go.
Suggestion as well if you want to hunt in Qeynos get someone to bind you at
the Gates of the City of Qeynos so if you die again you don't have to worry
about the gnolls any more

Halyburton

----- Original Message -----
From: "PsyKo" <sibilant_ghost@...>



> Hail, And well me John. You say you have a vast
> knowledge of Kunark?? well, maybe you can help me. I
> have a lvl 9 half-elf bard and he is stuck respawning
> in the arena, both surrounding zones are empty, but,
> whenever I try to leave Rathetear Lake I always meet
> up with some gnoll shamans and get slaughtered....
> One might ask how in all the worlds I got a lvl 9 bard
> safely to The Arena, Lets just say I abused SoW a
> little, I was spawning in Qeynos, and was trying to
> reach Freeport, and got lost somewhere in the
> middle... Any assistance in theis matter would be
> greatly appreciated,
> Stauchnad Tier Ss'Faleen
> Lowly Bard with big dreams.
